Tags: variable python class

Variable (python class)ÔÉÅ

See also

math concept | python sample

This section presents the Variable python class.

Note

Currently, the development of punctilious is focused on propositional logic. Support for bound and free variables in first-order logic is not yet implemented.

This class models a variable declared in a universe-of-discourse.

class punctilious.Variable(u, status=None, scope=None, symbol=None, index=None, auto_index=None, dashed_name=None, acronym=None, abridged_name=None, name=None, explicit_name=None, nameset=None, is_strictly_propositional=None, echo=None)ÔÉÅ
The defining-properties of a variable are:

  • Being an instance of the Variable class

  • The scope-formula of the variable

  • The index-position of the variable in its scope-formula

is_masked_formula_similar_to(phi, mask, _values)ÔÉÅ

Given two formulas o‚ÇÅ (self) and o‚ÇÇ, and a finite set of variables ùêå, return True if o‚ÇÅ and o‚ÇÇ are masked-formula-similar, False otherwise.

DefinitionÔÉÅ

Given two formulas o‚ÇÅ (self) and o‚ÇÇ, and a finite set of variables ùêå, o‚ÇÅ and o‚ÇÇ are masked-formula-similar if and only if:

  1. o‚ÇÅ is formula-syntactically-equivalent to o‚ÇÇ, including the special case when both o‚ÇÅ and o‚ÇÇ are symbolic-equivalent to a variable ùê± in ùêå,

  2. or the weaker condition that strictly one formula o‚ÇÅ or o‚ÇÇ is symbolic-equivalent to a variable ùê± in ùêå, and, denoting the other object the variable-observed-value, every variable-observed-value of ùê± are formula-syntactically-equivalent.

  3. or, if o‚ÇÅ or o‚ÇÇ are both formula, their components are masked-formula-similar.

NoteÔÉÅ

masked-formula-similitude is not a well-defined equivalence-class. In effect, equivalence-classes are reflexive, symmetric, and transitive. An obvious counterexample: (x + 1) ~ (5 + x). This is why it is called similitude and not equivalence.

ParametersÔÉÅ

phiFormula

A formula with which to verify masked-formula-similitude.

mask: set

Set of FreeVariable elements. If None, the empty set is assumed.

property is_strictly_propositional: boolÔÉÅ

A variable is denoted as propositional if a strict constraint is imposed on the objects it may be substituted with, that is only propositional objects.

When a variable is declared as propositional, punctilious assures through data-validation that it is never substituted by a non-propositional object.

property scopeÔÉÅ

The scope of a free variable is the set of the formula where the variable is used.

Returns:
